question:
Measles-Rubella vaccination campaign in Rajasthan has been in recent news. Which of the following statements about the campaign are correct?
  1. India accounts for 36% of measles death in the world.
  2. India aims to eliminate measles in the country by 2030.
  3. Measles is one of the diseases targeted under Mission Indradhanush.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: Measles is a contagious viral disease. It is however preventable with vaccination. Measles are prevalent in Asian and African regions. In India, 1.3 million are infected and 49,000 die annually- 36% of total measles deaths in the world. Statement 2 is incorrect: India plans to completely eradicate measles by 2020- in a manner similar to how polio was eradicated. Along with 10 South East Asian countries, India plans to eliminate measles and rubella. The country has already reported a huge drop in the number of measles cases. Mass immunisation drives are the main contributors to curbing of these infections- universal immunisation program with the measles rubella vaccine. Statement 3 is correct: Mission Indradhanush is a mission of the Indian government to eradicate 8 vaccine preventable diseases, including measles. Other diseases include Diphtheria, Japanese Enchephalitis, etc. In 2017, Intensified Mission Indradhanush was launched. This seeks to achieve full immunisation to at least 90% of the population.
